titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Theodore John Kreps Collection, 1926-1962 JL014
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Special Collections staff.

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-03T12:49-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Reports, memos, surveys, statistics, legal documents, and some printed material. Arrangement is chronological. Subjects included are cartels, anti-trust , labor, conservation, investment, reciprocal trade, government purchasing, production, government regulations, inflation, land-lease, war mobilization, and international trade.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Theodore John Kreps, born 13 January 1897 in Prinsburg, Minnesota, received his Ph.D from Harvard in 1928. He was professor of business economics at Stanford (1930-1962; emeritus, 1962- ).

chronitem.event: Instructor of history and economics at Colorado State °rep. - Boulder
Instructor of economics and tutor history, government and eccnomics at Harvard
Laura Spelman Rockefeller Fellow, Bureau of International Research
Chief, Statistics Section, National Recovery Administration; Chairman, Co-ordinating Committee of Central Statistical Board and Works Progress Administration
Representative U.S. Government to Preparatory Technical Tripartite Conference on Reduction of Hours in Chemical Industry, Geneva, Switzerland
Economic Adviser U.S. Maritime Commission 1938, 1941-1945 Economic Adviser, Anti-trust Division, Department of Justice
Economic Adviser, Temporary National Economic Commission
Chief Consultant, Office of Price Administration
Chief Economic Adviser, Board of Economic Warfare
Staff Director of the Joint Committee on the Economic Report
Ford Foundation exchange Professor to the Free University of Ber1in, Author of books, articles and reviews

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Reports, memos, surveys, statistics, legal documents, and some printed material. Arrangement is chronological. Subjects included are cartels, anti-trust , labor, conservation, investment, reciprocal trade, government purchasing, production, government regulations, inflation, land-lease, war mobilization, and international trade.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Theodore John Kreps to the Jackson Library of Business, 1966. Transferred to Special Collections in 1979.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Theodore John Kreps Collection. JL14. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cartel speeches; Webb-Pomerene Act; League of Nations publications (International Labour Office & Economic & Financial Section - standard of living of workers, dumping, monopolies); Federal Trade Commission anti-trust hearing; Income.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Price fixing; Cartels - German; Electrical industry trade practice rules; National Unemployment Program of the People's Lobby; Conservation (lumber); Dye Cartel; Investment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social audit; Anti-trust; Wholesale Drug Industry trade practice rules; Labor; Corporations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reciprocal trade - chemical; Government purchasing; profits, losses & business assets; German tobacco industry; Labor; Hugh B. White memo on corrosion resisting steel; Fire extinguishers; anti-trust; A.F. of L. Monthly Survey of Business; 1926 Price level; Exchange of corresnondence with Dept. of State re: entry of foreign ships into U.S. ports (copies); Investment; Production & Price Control in Bituminous Coal Mining.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Consumer, Statistics on Copper, 1926 Price level; Labor; Resale Price (Goodyear case); Government stimuli (silver policy); Formal complaints of Federal Trade Commission for unfair competition and price discrimination (anti-trust); answer to complaint; hearing; National Consumer News Proposed Revision of Anti-trust Laws; Foreign Systems Communist Election Platform; Consumer Credit, Debt & taxes.
